item.title: More barriers down and flytipping, 29th July

item.title: Written off car. Vandalised and defaced., 29th July
item.description:
Abandoned vehicle has been written off and left here since a crash at the start of June. First picture is from June 1st. The other pictures are from today where parts of the vehicle are being removed and it is being graffiti covers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beresford Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Already double bagged, decaying fox filled with maggots at the end of the drive of no 9 Cranbrook Close, 29th July
item.description:
This was reported on the morning of Friday 25th July. This fox had died on my driveway whilst I was away, severe decay had already started with flies and maggots covering the animal and driveway. It has been double bagged and is awaiting collection. Disgustingly putrid smell is coming from the bag. This is now a health hazard. My local councillors will be informed tomorrow afternoon.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cranbrook Close, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog foul on public footpath on property entrance., 29th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Broomwood Road, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Flytipping in Burwash Rd from 34 Durham Rise, 29th July
item.description:
A Flytipped bead frame left by the garage door of 34 Durham Rise on Burwash Road. Asked the resident if it was theirs and he said yes. He didn’t think he should move it. Fed up with constant Flytipping here by the residents of Durham rise. Second photo show the state outside their house. Needs something to be done to stop it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burwash Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
